Title: The 'Fantastic Four' Trailer Is Comic Accurate As Hell (Look at That Thing)
Paragraphs: ['By Mike Redmond | News | February 4, 2025 |', 'After years of seeming like this thing would go the way of Blade, Marvel has finally launched the first teaser for The Fantastic Four: First Steps, and they’re really spiking the ball on this puppy.', 'Starting at 7 AM, the studio kicked things off with a mock space launch that culminated in the cast appearing in a hangar with some light banter with Angelique Roche, who twice made it a point to say that the film kicks off a “new phase” for Marvel. In other words, we’ve got an MCU that’s looking to shake itself out of a slump.', 'As for the trailer, it plays. Much like Captain America: The First Avenger, the film takes the Fantastic Four back to their roots: The ’60s. The pastiche works, and a crazy comic accurate Thing (Ebon Moss-Bachrach) does a lot of heavy lifting. The second you see him interacting with H.E.R.B.I.E., the vibes kick in. It’s contagious. Not entirely sold on Pedro Pascal yet. Joe Quinn is not bad, but Vanessa Kirby is definitely stellar casting as Sue Storm. She was other-worldly in the launch event, and that didn’t even have special effects!', 'Granted, it’s early and I’m only on my first cup of coffee, but I did not see any signs of Julia Garner’s Silver Surfer. However, the trailer did make it a point to show that fans are going to get an actual Galactus, who isn’t a fart cloud in space. Most importantly, First Steps feels like a full-fledged, self-contained movie, and not just another piece of infinite puzzle even though that’s what it ultimately will be.', 'Anyway, that’s enough dorky jabbering, dive in:', '', '']

'Fantastic Four' Trailer Reveals Classic Marvel Villain's Surprising Comeback
Paragraphs: ['', '', '', '', '', 'Marvel\'s first superhero team-up is back, and this time, the keyword is "family." No, it\'s not a Fast & Furious movie, but the emotional theme of the first trailer for The Fantastic Four: First Steps is all about how the four titular superheroes see themselves as a family unit.', 'The just-released trailer from Marvel Studios firmly establishes that this film will take place in a retro-futuristic version of the 1960s, in which Reed Richards (Pedro Pascal), Sue Storm (Vanessa Kirby), Johnny Storm (Joseph Quinn), and Ben Grimm (Ebon Moss-Bachrach) are grappling with their superheroic transformations, following a fateful spaceflight.', "But, most surprisingly, the slick, nostalgic trailer also reveals who the villain will be for this movie, and it's someone comic book fans have been waiting a long time to see realized on the big screen. As Sue comforts Reed, assuring him that the Fantastic Four can handle whatever is thrown at them, we see the looming shadow of a massive head and very specific helmet.", "It's Galactus! This Marvel supervillain is a cosmic being who basically consumes entire worlds for sustenance. First introduced in Fantastic Four #48 in 1966, Galactus was a game-changer for comic book baddies. He's bigger than Thanos, and much more powerful than anything the MCU has revealed yet. In the film, Galactus will be played by Ralph Ineson, but the fact that Marvel stuck him in the first trailer is something of a shock.", 'Marvel Studios', "The introduction of Galactus to this sprawling film franchise could also help reconcile how The Fantastic Four: First Steps fits into the larger Marvel Cinematic Universe. We know this timeline doesn't quite match up with what we're used to in the world that contains Iron Man, Thor, and Captain America. But, if Galactus can consume entire worlds, then maybe, he also can change aspects of the multiverse. Or, even worse, what if the Fantastic Four end up in the regular MCU because their world is destroyed?"]

Title: The ‘Fantastic Four’ Trailer Is An Adjective You Can Guess
Paragraphs: ['The Fantastic Four: First Steps', 'Disney has finally released the Fantastic Four: First Steps trailer, bringing the Marvel’s First Family to the MCU in the biggest addition to the universe in an exceptionally long time. Arguably since the Avengers themselves first assembled.', 'The initial spot is a minute and a half long, and while yes, this is an MCU project, this movie is (at least at the start) taking place in an entirely separate universe akin to the Jetsons with ‘50s era aesthetics and seemingly no other superheroes around.', 'However the Fantastic Four end up meeting Thor and Hulk and all the rest remains to be seen, no doubt in Avengers: Doomsday, but there’s something refreshing about something totally divorced from everything else like this. And of course, we get our first look at its stellar cast, some of the most popular names in Hollywood right now, Pedro Pascal, Vanessa Kirby, Joseph Quinn and Ebon Moss-Bachrach as Mr. Fantastic, The Invisible Woman, The Human Torch and The Thing. Unless I missed a moment here, we see the last three members use their powers, but we don’t see Reed Richards doing any stretching. Interesting choice.', 'We get an extended look at Ebon Moss-Bachrach’s Thing, which is motion capture and something pretty tough to pull off. He, and the special effects, appear to be doing so. I really love the sound of rocks smacking together when he was clapping. It’s the little things.', 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps', 'Forbes Daily: Join over 1 million Forbes Daily subscribers and get our best stories, exclusive reporting and essential analysis of the day’s news in your inbox every weekday.', '', '', '', 'There are also big things. That includes Galactus looming over the city. No Silver Surfer yet though. Also no real fight scenes at all, which is fine for a first spot like this. It all comes together in a great package that is already being received very well by fans, despite supposed “MCU fatigue,” which is often proven not to be a real thing, as Deadpool and Wolverine just demonstrated last year.', 'It seems extremely likely that Fantastic Four will be a big hit for Marvel, likely bigger than either Captain America: Brave New World or Thunderbolts. Not necessarily because it will be better, but because it is a genuinely big deal that this group is hitting the MCU, and if all the trailers are this good, you can bet that everyone is definitely going to show up. The film is out July 25, 2025, so it’s less than six months until we see how it plays out.
